|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [monst.c#line1378](/wiki/Monst.c#line1378 "Monst.c") |

An **earth elemental**, E, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") [elemental](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") that is capable of [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing") through walls.

An earth elemental has a single claw attack, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

Weapons that use the [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") skill gain a +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus against earth elementals.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 As a polymorph form](#As_a_polymorph_form)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated earth elementals may be [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") towards [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") characters. Earth elementals generated on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth") will have three times as many hit points.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

In addition to random generation, an earth elemental may be generated as a [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of a neutral [god](/wiki/God "God").

Earth elementals are the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), making up 96⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Monk quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"). Several earth elementals are generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: eight on the home level, three on the upper filler level, fourteen on the locate level, two on the lower filler level(s), and nine on the goal level. They also appear among the random E that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for Monks, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated there. Earth elementals additionally appear among the the random E that are part of the second quest class for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest").

Twenty-seven hostile earth elementals are generated across the various caverns on the Plane of Earth at level creation.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Digging with a pick-axe or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock") has an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating an earth elemental on each adjacent square.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Earth elementals are not a valid target for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"). An earth elemental [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

## Strategy

Individually, earth elementals are slow and hard-hitting monsters that can be dealt with relatively easily at the point you encounter them, though their phasing can make them quite annoying. Large groups of earth elementals can be quite dangerous, since their phasing allows them to surround you quite easily and cut off some of the usual escape routes - this is a particular hazard on the Monk quest, where every level pairs them with [xorns](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn") that can also phase and hit similarly hard, and both can move effortlessly through the [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") forts some Monks employ as a defense against [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen").

### As a polymorph form

Earth elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for travel purposes - while they move at half the base speed of a normal character, they are one of only two monsters capable of phasing normally (with the other being the [xorn](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn")), and there are fewer areas with unphaseable walls than undiggable ones. In this regard, the earth elemental is an inferior polyform to the xorn, since it cannot wear any armor while xorns can at least wear non-torso armor; one of their few advantages is that they cannot be genocided, which keeps phasing attainable in the rare cases where xorns are wiped out (e.g., by a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") attempting to farm [wraiths](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith") on the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest")).

## History

The earth elemental first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Messages

- The debris from your digging comes to life!

  Earth elementals were generated from digging using a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock.

## Variants

In variants that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") role, one or two earth elementals are generated on the lower filler level(s) of the [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest") at level creation.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), zapping an earth elemental with a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") will halve its current HP.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

Earth elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest monster class for [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mages "Flame Mages"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Flame Mage quest](/wiki/Flame_Mage_quest "Flame Mage quest").

At least one earth elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one being placed nearby.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), 1⁄10 of the monsters randomly generated on the Earth Temple level of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") will be earth elementals.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), ten earth elementals are generated on the [Gemstone Array](/wiki/Gemstone_Array "Gemstone Array") at level creation.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), earth elementals are given an additional engulfing attack.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the [greater earth elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_earth_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater earth elemental (page does not exist)"), though earth elementals cannot [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into them.

The [Acid Mage](/wiki/Acid_Mage "Acid Mage") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [The Flute of Slime](/index.php?title=The_Flute_of_Slime\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Flute of Slime (page does not exist)"), can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to summon tame earth elementals, and has a 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard one and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater one.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 43](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L43): *elementals and home planes*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1012): *max HP for elementals on home planes*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1825): *max HP gain for elementals on home planes*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [dat/endgame.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 57](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dat/endgame.des#L57)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 444](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L444)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [mondata.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 206](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mondata.h#line206 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mondata.h")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Earth elemental

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
E earth elemental
Difficulty 10
Attacks Claw 4d6
E earth elemental
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Claw 4d6

Base level 8
Base experience 126
Speed 6
Base AC 2
Base MR 30
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 2500
Nutritional value 0
Size Huge
Resistances fire, cold, poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed None

An earth elemental:

  • can phase through walls.
  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • has a thick hide.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is strong.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference monst.c#line1378

An earth elemental, E, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a strong, thick-skinned elemental that is capable of phasing through walls.

An earth elemental has a single claw attack, and possesses poison resistance, fire resistance, cold resistance, and stoning resistance.

Weapons that use the pick-axe skill gain a +2 to-hit bonus against earth elementals.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 As a polymorph form
  • 3 History
  • 4 Messages
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 dNetHack
    • 5.3 SpliceHack
    • 5.4 EvilHack
    • 5.5 SlashTHEM
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated earth elementals may be peaceful towards neutral characters. Earth elementals generated on the Plane of Earth will have three times as many hit points.[1][2][3]

In addition to random generation, an earth elemental may be generated as a minion of a neutral god.

Earth elementals are the first quest monster for Monks, making up 96⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Monk quest. Several earth elementals are generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: eight on the home level, three on the upper filler level, fourteen on the locate level, two on the lower filler level(s), and nine on the goal level. They also appear among the random E that are part of the first quest monster class for Monks, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated there. Earth elementals additionally appear among the the random E that are part of the second quest class for Samurai, and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Samurai quest.

Twenty-seven hostile earth elementals are generated across the various caverns on the Plane of Earth at level creation.[4] Digging with a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock has an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating an earth elemental on each adjacent square.[5]

Earth elementals are not a valid target for genocide. An earth elemental does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Individually, earth elementals are slow and hard-hitting monsters that can be dealt with relatively easily at the point you encounter them, though their phasing can make them quite annoying. Large groups of earth elementals can be quite dangerous, since their phasing allows them to surround you quite easily and cut off some of the usual escape routes - this is a particular hazard on the Monk quest, where every level pairs them with xorns that can also phase and hit similarly hard, and both can move effortlessly through the boulder forts some Monks employ as a defense against Master Kaen.

As a polymorph form

Earth elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for travel purposes - while they move at half the base speed of a normal character, they are one of only two monsters capable of phasing normally (with the other being the xorn), and there are fewer areas with unphaseable walls than undiggable ones. In this regard, the earth elemental is an inferior polyform to the xorn, since it cannot wear any armor while xorns can at least wear non-torso armor; one of their few advantages is that they cannot be genocided, which keeps phasing attainable in the rare cases where xorns are wiped out (e.g., by a Wizard attempting to farm wraiths on the Wizard quest).

History

The earth elemental first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Messages

The debris from your digging comes to life!
Earth elementals were generated from digging using a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock.

Variants

In variants that incorporate the Convict role, one or two earth elementals are generated on the lower filler level(s) of the Convict quest at level creation.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, zapping an earth elemental with a wand of digging will halve its current HP.[6]

Earth elementals appear among the random E that are part of the first quest monster class for Flame Mages, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Flame Mage quest.

At least one earth elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the Lawful Quest at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one being placed nearby.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, 1⁄10 of the monsters randomly generated on the Earth Temple level of the Chaos Temple Quest will be earth elementals.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, ten earth elementals are generated on the Gemstone Array at level creation.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, earth elementals are given an additional engulfing attack.

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds the greater earth elemental, though earth elementals cannot grow up into them.

The Acid Mage quest artifact, The Flute of Slime, can be invoked to summon tame earth elementals, and has a 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard one and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater one.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 43: elementals and home planes
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012: max HP for elementals on home planes
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825: max HP gain for elementals on home planes
  4. ↑ dat/endgame.des in NetHack 3.6.7, line 57
  5. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 444
  6. ↑ mondata.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 206

An '''earth elemental''', {{monsym|earth elemental}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[strong]], [[thick-skinned]] [[elemental]] that is capable of [[phasing]] through walls.

An earth elemental has a single claw attack, and possesses [[poison resistance]], [[fire resistance]], [[cold resistance]], and [[stoning resistance]].

Weapons that use the [[pick-axe]] skill gain a +2 [[to-hit]] bonus against earth elementals.

==Generation==
Randomly generated earth elementals may be [[peaceful]] towards [[neutral]] characters. Earth elementals generated on the [[Plane of Earth]] will have three times as many hit points.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|43|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=elementals and home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1012|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP for elementals on home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1825|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP gain for elementals on home planes}}

In addition to random generation, an earth elemental may be generated as a [[minion]] of a neutral [[god]].

Earth elementals are the first [[quest]] monster for [[Monk]]s, making up {{frac|96|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Monk quest]]. Several earth elementals are generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: eight on the home level, three on the upper filler level, fourteen on the locate level, two on the lower filler level(s), and nine on the goal level. They also appear among the random {{white|E}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for Monks, and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated there. Earth elementals additionally appear among the the random {{white|E}} that are part of the second quest class for [[Samurai]], and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Samurai quest]].

Twenty-seven hostile earth elementals are generated across the various caverns on the Plane of Earth at level creation.{{refsrc|dat/endgame.des|57|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Digging with a pick-axe or [[dwarvish mattock]] has an effective {{frac|6}} chance of generating an earth elemental on each adjacent square.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|444|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

Earth elementals are not a valid target for [[genocide]]. An earth elemental [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

==Strategy==
Individually, earth elementals are slow and hard-hitting monsters that can be dealt with relatively easily at the point you encounter them, though their phasing can make them quite annoying. Large groups of earth elementals can be quite dangerous, since their phasing allows them to surround you quite easily and cut off some of the usual escape routes - this is a particular hazard on the Monk quest, where every level pairs them with [[xorn]]s that can also phase and hit similarly hard, and both can move effortlessly through the [[boulder]] forts some Monks employ as a defense against [[Master Kaen]].

===As a polymorph form===
Earth elementals are sometimes used as a polyself form for travel purposes - while they move at half the base speed of a normal character, they are one of only two monsters capable of phasing normally (with the other being the [[xorn]]), and there are fewer areas with unphaseable walls than undiggable ones. In this regard, the earth elemental is an inferior polyform to the xorn, since it cannot wear any armor while xorns can at least wear non-torso armor; one of their few advantages is that they cannot be genocided, which keeps phasing attainable in the rare cases where xorns are wiped out (e.g., by a [[Wizard]] attempting to farm [[wraith]]s on the [[Wizard quest]]).

==History==
The earth elemental first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|The debris from your digging comes to life!|Earth elementals were generated from digging using a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock.}}

==Variants==
In variants that incorporate the [[Convict]] role, one or two earth elementals are generated on the lower filler level(s) of the [[Convict quest]] at level creation.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], zapping an earth elemental with a [[wand of digging]] will halve its current HP.{{refsrc|mondata.h|206|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Earth elementals appear among the random {{white|E}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Flame Mages]], and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Flame Mage quest]].

At least one earth elemental is generated within the Cloud Bank of the [[Lawful Quest]] at level creation, with a {{frac|3|5}} chance of a second one being placed nearby.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], {{frac|10}} of the monsters randomly generated on the Earth Temple level of the [[Chaos Temple Quest]] will be earth elementals.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], ten earth elementals are generated on the [[Gemstone Array]] at level creation.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], earth elementals are given an additional engulfing attack.

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds the [[greater earth elemental]], though earth elementals cannot [[grow up]] into them.

The [[Acid Mage]] [[quest artifact]], [[The Flute of Slime]], can be [[invoked]] to summon tame earth elementals, and has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating a standard one and a {{frac|4}} chance of generating a greater one.
